column4: How do I install debconf? apt-get dies cause debconf isnt installed
soundray? any ideas
do you have a deb for debconf in /var/cache/apt/archives/ ?
yes
see if you can install it with 'sudo dpkg -i /var/cache/apt/archives/debconf*deb
Can't locate Debconf/Db.pm in @INC
how did you get into this situation?
is there a package i can install that contains the Debconf perl modules?
they are in the debconf package. You've got a classic catch 22. How did you get into this situation?
i told you
i had to reinstall perl manually to get rid of threads
how is it a catch 22 if the system installs it in a state without debconf in the first place
debconf is probably in the seed archive
seed archive?
I have only rudimentary knowledge, but I think when you install, the first thing that goes onto your disk is a "seed" system that is unpacked from a .tar.gz
well there's gotta be a way to install it
anyway, what you should do is read man dpkg to find out how to unpack a package (sorry, I don't know how offhand) and put the components into place with cp
the components of debconf, I mean
have you been able to repair your debconf?
yes using aptitude
wow - apt-get failed, but aptitude worked?
yep
that's amazing, well done
